column5: Kind of reminds me of that bozo here in Canada that prorogues parliament every time the heat is on him.  That's what I was thinking.   But could you imagine if government employees all got sent home with no pay during prorogation?   That would ruffle a few feathers.
I'm sure there's endless forums for political discussion.  Google them.
Dare we start a thread on this!?  I for one, am not sure what to think.

You have to wonder why they'd be contemplating another expensive war in a foreign country if they can't afford to keep their museums and parks open.  Even assuming their motivations are 100% pure...I know if I couldn't pay my gas bill, I wouldn't be offering to help my neighbour out in at some endeavor that is crazy expensive and may have no end.

I'll tell you what, without making it a them and us or these and those ones, it can happen to any country that is controlled by an elite group.  They/we/most of us, don't have a revenue problem, we have massive spending problems, right from the bottom of the pile, Joe /Jane Public to the top of the Government heap.  People keep spending beyond their means.  Every little p/ant self centered group crys the blues and has money thrown at it. Stop it and only spend money where it is realy needed.  If you run a deficit and have a debt, you will never see the light at the end of the tunnel..other than the train that's going to run your sorry butt over.  If you want a 60 inch flat screen in every room with a bathroom for every room in the house, you either have the money to pay for it or you are in debt...'til death do you part from it.
Chris Hall‏@cshallwriter7h America was not shut down properly. Would you like to start America in safe mode, with free healthcare and without the guns? (Recommended)
Why is it that you and I and all us "little guys" know what the problem is, and how to fix it.....and our "LEADERS" (term used loosely) can't ???????
Chris Hall‏@cshallwriter7h America was not shut down properly. Would you like to start America in safe mode, with free healthcare and without the guns? (Recommended)  I like that.

They aren't closing museums, parks, etc because they can't afford them (that's another battle).  It's just a disagreement on passing a budget.  Without agreement there is no budget, so they are legally forced to close.
When you live in a much warmer climate the heat can bake the brains! LOL
Oh Yeah Paul, there are plenty of baked brains on the Hill today!!

sharp drop in gold, but otherwise no sell off on the markets. Guess it's not a big deal yet??? Until the next big item in a couple weeks: the massively tall debt ceiling!!  The republicans are loving a government shutdown: "see, we don't need museums and parks" haha
800,000 civil servants home without pay today! Maybe they found their financial problem....
They know how to resolve this issue. They have chosen not to.
Time to send a raiding party across the border to rape and pillage!!!!
Business as usual down here for me today. I didnt even notice they were missing?

seems the republicans only agree with democracy when it's going their way.   obama was elected on a platform that HEAVILY pushed obamacare.  so in order to keep  it from passing the GOP cripples the country UNLESS obamacare is defunded?  glad i live in a country where good health is a right, not a privilege.

This is not a money issue it is the government holding our spending hostage till we get rid of the obamacare crap that will ruin our country. As for guns if there is no government then I am glad I am armed at least there will be one wolf in the pasture protecting the livestock. lol Give it a few days and they will come up with some kind of answer that will keep both sides of the government happy as for the people.....who knows. Couldn't agree more Doc..However politics talk is loose loose and this is where im out..Harper is no better but, at least we have a somewhat functioning government today...

Just finished a novel Brad Thor : Hidden Order which uses the US Federal Reserve as a back story. Yes its fiction but the back story about the federal reserve history and function are a real eye opener. Its written like a Dan Brown suspense novel with a sprinkling of odd true facts that catch you off guard. Very interesting topic that I think I will research a little...
